definition: in a fit of pique/in a fury
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi
(possessive particle, literary equivalent of 的[de5])/him/her/it
down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action

sentences.english: Black ant cant stand stimulation in a pet like the giant killer.
sentences.chinese: 黑蚁受不了激，一气之下就想对擎天下杀手。

sentences.english: In his flay, he screwed up her letter and threw it into the wastepaper basket.
sentences.chinese: 他一气之下，把她写来的信揉成一团，扔进了。

sentences.english: So, I got the refrigerator and pushed it over the balcony and it crushed him.
sentences.chinese: 一气之下，我搬出冰箱，推下阳台，砸到了他身上。

sentences.english: Finally the captain still did not agree. He was so angry that he went to find the bureau director.
sentences.chinese: 最后大队长还是不同意，他一气之下又去找。

sentences.english: Cao, infuriated, ordered him to the battle front, hoping the enemy's sword would kill him.
sentences.chinese: 曹操一气之下，命他立即出征，借敌人的刀杀了祢衡。

sentences.english: Cao， infuriated， ordered him to the battle front， hoping the enemy's sword would kill him.
sentences.chinese: 曹操一气之下，命他立即出征，借敌人的刀杀了祢衡。

sentences.english: Yifan throws a necklace that was given to her by Yiguan into a lake.
sentences.chinese: 一帆一气之下将一官送给她的项链丢进小溪里。

sentences.english: He clawed a hole in my shirt in his temper.
sentences.chinese: 他一气之下把我的衬衫撕了一个口子。

sentences.english: Tian Juhua think iron tiger abandon her, in a pet tiger boom to the iron door.
sentences.chinese: 田菊华以为铁虎嫌弃她，一气之下把铁虎轰出门去。

sentences.english: Nixon gave his angry “last press conference.”
sentences.chinese: 尼克松一气之下召开了他的“最后一次新闻发布会”。

sentences.english: In his anger he hit the man and a fight ensued.
sentences.chinese: 一气之下，他打了那个人，接着是一场搏斗。

sentences.english: Wife angrily, ready to pull the dog to go out.
sentences.chinese: 妻子一气之下，准备牵狗出门了。

definition: so angry it's unbearable/bitter about unbearable grievances
in a pique/sulky/cross
more than one can bear (idiom); at the end of one's patience/the last straw
to act in a fit of pique/to get in a huff/to be peeved
to harbor hard feelings
to be furious/to fly into a terrible rage
furious/enraged
to leave home (to live somewhere else)
to get really angry
who would have thought/unexpectedly
see 二話不說|二话不说[er4 hua4 bu4 shuo1]
(literary) angry/irate
discouraged/downhearted
to fly into a rage out of humiliation/to be ashamed into anger (idiom)
indignant/furious
unexpectedly/to one's surprise
